channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Series of sunken paving slabs, 29th August
item.description:
The paving slabs seem to have sunk simultaneously, close to the entrance of the store Fat Face, immediately opposite the former House of Fraser at the top of the Promenade.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50-50a, Promenade, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Broken bridge slats, 29th August
item.description:
These have been reported in a number of occasions before and the matter has not been resolved and is becoming quite dangerous. 3-4 slats are completely missing and are a serious risk if I just. This needs URGENT attention as it is a vital thoroughfare. Please make an effort to resolve this before it becomes an emergency. Suggest you check ALL slats rather than just bridge the existing problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gevum Way, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: High kerbstone due to new road sufface that isnt as good as the old one ,why should i have to suffer for the contractors inept resurfacing, 29th August
item.description:

item.title: Grass verge needs cutting so that I can cut my hedge, 29th August
item.description:
The verge on the Shurdington Road between Silverthorne Close and Kenelm Gardens needs cutting urgently. Our house at 67 Merestones Drive has gated access and we are trying to sell our house. I cannot cut my hedge on the road side due to this and it is full of litter and a major eyesore which is not helping our house sale. This used to be lawn which I looked after until the pavement was made wider and nobody appears to be looking after it now. Please can you cut all the weeds down as soon as possible. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two dead ash trees, one has been blown down in the high winds, 29th August
item.description:
Next to 20 Hartlebury Way, lying across the river Chelt. One of the trees have been blown down in the high winds earlier this week. Concerned that the remaining standing tree may fall into my garden in 32 Castlefields Avenue damaging the green house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Hartlebury Way, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 29th August
item.description:
27/08/24 emails rcvd from Cheltenham BC regarding issue (full trail attached): Customer reporting that the trees to the rear of the property are not maintained, and regularly drop large branches onto the ground - recently a branch fell off and landed on the property fence. Customer asking if these trees can be inspected and cut back/pollarded.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 29th August
item.description:
Traffic lights and previous signage obscured by trees Cllr: See email below - I travelled this road yesterday and can confirm that coming from the Cheltenham direction you can't see the traffic lights until you are very near them. Vegetation needs to be cut back not just at the traffic lights themselves please but also in the run up to them so that drivers can see in advance. I reported vegetation obscuring traffic lights and signage on A40 at Shipton Olliffe at the end of July via FixMyStreet... (Received update that work had been done)...I have just been up to check and from the photos you can see nothing has been done. (Full email with photos attached) (Relates to 11463930/42540310)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parking opposite junction, 29th August
item.description:
Cars parked opposite a busy junction are causing issues with traffic. Especially during school pick up and drop off. There have been numerous near misses, this is an accident waiting to happen. Please extend yellow lines to avoid this issue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 29th August
item.description:
It is overgrown and encourages litter. My question to you is - Why are we being treated differently to the residents who live in other parts of the village? We feel we are being discriminaed against just because of where we live. We pay the same council tax so should therefore expect the same level of service. I have been raising this issue since June and your customer service team promised an additional cut which has just not happened. Many residents mow some of the area themselves. I mow infront of 6 houses as my neighbours are elderly and would have to pay for someone to do it. Many of the areas are not directly infront of anyone's property so are left. One lady at the end of Crown Drive pays someone to maintain the triangle of grass and bushes. Surely this is not right. I appreciate there is a cost implication but surely we should all be treated the same. I look forward to your response.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction when parking cars in the marked zones which we pay a permit to park., 29th August
item.description:
Grass verge located next to a parking bay, trip hazard when exiting cars, large mound with non visable hole pedestrians would trip/fall and cause injury.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-14, Pittville Circus Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
